member.summary: Utility methods for working with images in WPF.

members.member: The timeout to use for Web requests, in milliseconds.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WpfGraphicsLib.WpfImageUtil.GetImageSynchronous(System.String)
member.summary: Synchronously gets an image from a specified URI and handles most errors by returning an error image.
member.param: The URI to get the image from. If the string is not a valid URI, an error image is returned.
member.returns: The specified image, or an error image if the specified image isn't available.
member.remarks:
There are two differences between using this method and using BitmapImage(URI):
If the URI is an URL, the image is downloaded synchronously instead of asynchronously.
If the image isn't available, an error image is returned instead of an exception being thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WpfGraphicsLib.WpfImageUtil.GetImageSynchronousIgnoreDpi(System.String)
member.summary: Synchronously gets an image from a specified URI, handles most errors by returning an error image, and ignores the DPI of the image.
member.param: The URI to get the image from. If the string is not a valid URI, an error image is returned.
member.returns: The specified image, or an error image if the specified image isn't available.
member.remarks:
There are three differences between using this method and using BitmapImage(URI):
If the URI is an URL, the image is downloaded synchronously instead of asynchronously.
If the image isn't available, an error image is returned instead of an exception being thrown.
If the image is marked with a DPI of something other than the screen resolution specified by , the marked DPI is ignored and the returned image will have a DPI of . For example, with a 96 DPI screen, a 100x100-pixel image with a DPI of 72 will be returned as a 100x100-WPF-unit image with a DPI of 96. This will cause the returned image to be displayed as 100x100 pixels.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WpfGraphicsLib.WpfImageUtil.GetImageSynchronousHttp(System.Uri)
member.summary: Synchronously gets an image from a specified HTTP or HTTPS URI.
member.param: The URI to get the image from. Must be HTTP or HTTPS.
member.returns: The specified image.
member.remarks:
No error handling is performed by this method.
This differs from using BitmapImage(URI) in that the image is downloaded synchronously instead of asynchronously.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NodeXL.Visualization.Wpf.GraphDrawer
member.summary: Draws a NodeXL graph onto a collection of Visual objects.
member.remarks:
This is used to draw a NodeXL graph in a WPF application. It contains a collection of Visual objects that represent the graph's vertices and edges. Call to draw a laid-out NodeXL graph onto the contained .
does not lay out the graph. You should lay out the graph using one of the provided layout classes before calling .
A cannot be directly rendered and is typically not used directly by an application. Applications typically use one of two other NodeXL graph-drawing classes:
NodeXLControl, which is a FrameworkElement that wraps a and hosts its . NodeXLControl is meant for use in WPF desktop applications. It automatically lays out the graph before drawing it.
, which is a Visual that wraps a and hosts its . This is a lower-level alternative to NodeXLControl and can be used anywhere a Visual is more appropriate than a FrameworkElement. Like , does not lay out the graph before drawing it.
If you do use directly, rendering the graph requires a custom wrapper that hosts the GraphDrawer. object.

member.summary: Redraws a vertex that was drawn by .

member.name: M:Microsoft.NodeXL.Visualization.Wpf.GraphDrawer.AddVisualOnTopOfGraph(System.Windows.Media.Visual)
member.summary: Temporarily adds a caller-supplied Visual on top of the drawn graph.
member.param: The Visual to add on top of the graph.
member.remarks:
Call this method after calling to add a Visual on top of the graph. This is useful for adding a temporary tooltip, dragging marquee, or other Visual object to the graph.
The added Visual gets removed when is called again. You can also remove the Visual without redrawing the graph by calling .
An InvalidOperationException is thrown if the Visual has already been added.

member.name: M:Microsoft.NodeXL.Visualization.Wpf.GraphDrawer.RemoveVisualFromTopOfGraph(System.Windows.Media.Visual)
member.summary: Removes the caller-supplied Visual from the top of the graph.
member.param: The Visual to remove from the top of the graph.
member.remarks:
Use this method to remove the Visual added to the top of the graph by without redrawing the graph. The Visual also gets removed if is called again.
If the Visual doesn't exist in the VisualCollection, which will occur if was called after the Visual was added, this method does nothing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the graph's background color.
member.value: The graph's background color, as a . The default value is SystemColors..
member.remarks:
When the graph is drawn, the background color specified by this property is drawn first, followed by any background image specified by , followed by the graph itself.
This is called BackColor instead of BackgroundColor for consistency with the rest of the .NET Framework.

member.name: P:Microsoft.NodeXL.Visualization.Wpf.GraphDrawer.GraphScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the scale of the graph's vertices and edges.
member.value: A value that determines the scale of the graph's vertices and edges. Must be between and . The default value is 1.0.
member.remarks: If the value is anything besides 1.0, the graph's vertices and edges are shrunk while their positions remain the same. If it is set to 0.5, for example, the vertices are half their normal size and the edges are half their normal width. The overall size of the graph is not affected.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Research.CommunityTechnologies.AppLib.ArgumentChecker
member.summary: Contains methods that check method arguments and property values.
member.remarks:
This can be used by a class that wants to check values passed to its property setters and arguments passed to its methods. The CheckXXX() methods in this class throw an exception if a parameter value or method argument is invalid.
This class is marked internal to avoid compiler error CS0433 ("The type ... exists in both ...") when an executable references two or more assemblies that use this class.

member.remarks: Call this method when the value passed to a property setter is invalid. It throws an exception whose message automatically includes the class and property names.
member.example: If the class name that was passed to the constructor is "MyClass", is "MyProperty", and is "The value can't be null.", then the new exception's message is "MyClass.MyProperty: The value can't be null."

member.name: P:Microsoft.NodeXL.Visualization.Wpf.VertexAndEdgeDrawerBase.GraphScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the scale of the graph's vertices and edges.
member.value: A value that determines the scale of the graph's vertices and edges. Must be between and . The default value is 1.0.
member.remarks: If the value is anything besides 1.0, the graph's vertices and edges are shrunk while their positions remain the same. If it is set to 0.5, for example, the vertices are half their normal size and the edges are half their normal width. The overall size of the graph is not affected.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NodeXL.Visualization.Wpf.EdgeDrawer
member.summary: Draws a graph's edges.
member.remarks:
This class is responsible for drawing a graph's edges. The default edge appearance is determined by this class's properties. The appearance of an individual edge can be overridden by adding appropriate metadata to the edge. The following metadata keys are honored:
The values of the and keys can be of type System.Windows.Media.Color or System.Drawing.Color.
If is true, an edge is drawn using or , depending on whether the edge has been marked as selected. If is false, is used regardless of whether the edge has been marked as selected.
When drawing the graph, call for each of the graph's edges.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NodeXL.Visualization.Wpf.VertexDrawer
member.summary: Draws a graph's vertices.
member.remarks:
This class is responsible for drawing a graph's vertices. The default vertex appearance is determined by this class's properties. The appearance of an individual vertex can be overridden by adding appropriate metadata to the vertex. The following metadata keys are honored:
If is true, a vertex is drawn using or , depending on whether the vertex has been marked as selected. If is false, is used regardless of whether the vertex has been marked as selected.
If a vertex has the shape and has the key, the vertex is drawn as a rectangle containing the text specified by the key's value. The default color of the text and the rectangle's outline is , but can be overridden with the key. The default fill color of the rectangle is , but can be overridden with the key.
If a vertex has a shape other than and has the key, the vertex is drawn as the specified shape, and the text specified by the key's value is drawn next to the vertex as an annotation at the position determined by .
If a vertex has the shape and has the key, the vertex is drawn as the image specified by the key's value.
The values of the and keys can be of type System.Windows.Media.Color or System.Drawing.Color.
When drawing the graph, call for each of the graph's vertices.

members.member: Maximum width of a label shape, not including the label padding, in device-independent units.
Maximum height of a label shape, not including the label padding, in device-independent units.

member.name: T:Microsoft.NodeXL.Visualization.Wpf.VertexLabelPosition
member.summary: Specifies the position of a vertex label drawn as an annotation.
member.remarks:
The positions are used only for vertex labels drawn as an annotation. They are not used when a vertex has the shape .
The horizontal positions are called Left, Center, and Right. The vertical positions are called Top, Middle, and Bottom. The label positions with respect to the vertex's rectangle are shown above.

example.code: TopCenter TopLeft -------------- TopRight | | | | MiddleLeft | MiddleCenter | MiddleRight | | | | BottomLeft -------------- BottomRight BottomCenter
